words.definition: When someone has anxiety, they have a lot of worries and fear.
words.example: When I have to climb to high places, Iâ€™m filled with anxiety.

words.definition: An army is a large group of people who fight in wars.
words.example: The army protects all the people in the country.

words.definition: A billion is a very large number: 1,000,000,000.
words.example: There are billions of stars in outer space.

words.definition: To carve means to cut into something.
words.example: My father usually carves the turkey for Thanksgiving.

words.definition: To consult someone means to ask them for help.
words.example: I will consult my accountant to find a way to pay for my bills.

words.definition: An emergency is a time when someone needs help right away.
words.example: There is a huge fire in my house! This is an emergency!

words.definition: When someone has good fortune, it means they have luck.
words.example: I have good fortune when I play cards.

words.definition: To guarantee means to know something will happen.
words.example: I guarantee that the sun will come up in the morning.

words.definition: To hike means to walk in the mountains or forest.
words.example: I always bring plenty of equipment with me when I hike.

words.definition: When something is initial, it is the first thing.
words.example: The initial step when writing a paper is to find a good topic.

words.definition: If something is intense, it is very strong.
words.example: The heat from the sun was very intense.

words.definition: To lend something is to give it to someone for a short time.
words.example: My sister lent me her car for the weekend.

words.definition: The peak is the very top of a mountain.
words.example: We reached the peak after many hours of climbing.

words.definition: Potential means that something could happen in the future.
words.example: He has the potential to be a great musician.

words.definition: Pride is a feeling of satisfaction from your own achievements.
words.example: I take great pride in my work.

words.definition: Proof is something that shows that something is true.
words.example: I have proof that I was at home last night.

words.definition: To quit is to stop doing something.
words.example: He quit his job last week.

words.definition: To spin is to turn around and around, very quickly.
words.example: The fan spins to keep us cool.

words.definition: When something is tiny, it is very small.
words.example: The baby has tiny hands.

words.definition: A tutor is a person who gives lessons to one student.
words.example: My parents hired a tutor to help me with math.
